intro: Timeroyea canalensis, commonly known as the canalensis timeroyea, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial shade. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
